'[2649-he] At half - past three [he]2649-he got back to [[his]2649-he lodgings]2654-his lodgings , and sat down with the resolution of going thoroughly into [his]2649-he financial affairs . To that [he]2649-he thought [he]2649-he would devote an hour or two , and in the evening [he]2649-he would try to find the lost clue in [Spray 's Buildings]24-spray 's buildings . This looking into [his]2649-he finances struck [him]2649-he as being a business - like sort of thing to do , and quite in harmony with [his]2649-he present frame of mind . [He]2649-he was soon busy at [his]2649-he light writing - table . Presently [he]2649-he drew from a drawer [[his]2649-he banker]2655-his banker 's pass - book , made bulky with cancelled cheques . [He]2649-he groaned earnestly . ' Alas ! '[2649-he] [he]2649-he said to [himself]2649-he , ' how sadly simple and easy it is to sign [one]504-one 's name on this nice smooth coloured paper . ' A most unfounded statement , born of ignorance of business , and a desire to seem to [himself]2649-he as one who understood it . Suddenly [he]2649-he started , and singled out the cheque [he]2649-he had given to [Hirsch]222-hirsch in the autumn . ' [He]2649-he went on steadily with [his]2649-he self - imposed task of comparing each cheque with the entry in the book . '[2659-our] Aha ! the mysterious [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch is punctual , ' [he]2649-he said to [himself]2649-he . It was [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , though perhaps [those who had seen most of [him]179-petrovitch in the last few months]4439-those who had seen most of him in the last few months would have failed to recognise [him]179-petrovitch . [He]179-petrovitch looked at least ten years younger . The handsome long light beard was gone , and [he]179-petrovitch was close shaved save for a heavy drooping blond moustache . As [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff heard [[his]121-litvinoff visitor]3901-his visitor 's steps upon [the stairs]369-the stairs [he]2649-he settled [himself]2649-he back in [his]2649-he chair , with an assumption of a business air , much like that of [a very young lawyer about to receive [a new client]4443-a new client]4442-a very young lawyer about to receive a new client . There was a sharp rap at the room door . '[179-petrovitch] Come in , ' [he]2649-he said . The door opened . [He]2649-he sprang to [his]2649-he feet , stood one moment clutching at the table before [him]2649-he , [his]2649-he eyes wide with something that seemed almost terror , and [his]2649-he whole frame rigid with astonishment . Then [his]2649-he expression changed to one of deepest love and delight . There was a crash of furniture , as [he]2649-he flung the little writing - table from [him]2649-he , and it fell shattered against the opposite wall . With a hysterical cry of '[179-petrovitch] Ah , ah , ah , [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff ! back from the dead ! ' [he]2649-he sprang across [the room]2910-the room , threw [his]2649-he arms round [the other]305-the other 's neck , and fell sobbing on [his]2649-he breast . BEFORE the echo of that cry had died away , [the man who had uttered it]4446-the man who had uttered it swayed sideways , [his]2649-he face grew deadly white , the clasp of [his]2649-he arms loosened , and only the sudden firm grip of the other saved [him]2649-he from falling . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch laid [him]2649-he on the sofa . Then [he]179-petrovitch passed into [the adjoining bedroom]4447-the adjoining bedroom , and came back with a wet sponge . '[2662-a fellow it] What [a fellow it]2662-a fellow it is , ' [he]179-petrovitch said to [himself]179-petrovitch , as [he]179-petrovitch applied it to the hands and face of [the insensible man]4448-the insensible man . '[2662-a fellow it] As brave as a lion , and as hysterical as [a schoolgirl]541-a schoolgirl . ' But [he]179-petrovitch looked very kindly on the pale face as [he]179-petrovitch administered [his]179-petrovitch remedies . '[121-litvinoff] [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , it is [you]121-litvinoff , then ? ' [he]179-petrovitch said in a low voice , and covered [his]179-petrovitch face with [his]179-petrovitch hands . '[121-litvinoff] Yes , [Percival]276-percival , it is [I]0-i , ' said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch ; '[0-i] but let this be the last time [you]276-percival call [me]0-i [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , and [I]0-i must not call [you]276-percival [Percival]276-percival either . ' '[179-petrovitch] Then [you]179-petrovitch are [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch ! Why did [you]179-petrovitch take a false name to mislead [me]0-i ? ' [he]0-i groaned . '[179-petrovitch] Why did [you]179-petrovitch let [me]0-i go on wearing [your]179-petrovitch name , and spending [your]179-petrovitch money ? ' '[0-i] And yet [you]179-petrovitch seemed glad to see [me]0-i , too ? ' said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , looking at [him]179-petrovitch curiously . '[179-petrovitch] But [I]0-i took no false name ; [my]0-i name is really [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch . [[My]0-i father]3241-my father 's name was [Peter]176-mr peter hitch , [you]179-petrovitch know . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i never thought of [you]179-petrovitch by it , though ; and besides , [I]0-i thought [you]179-petrovitch were dead . [You]179-petrovitch know that [I]0-i thought [you]179-petrovitch were dead ? ' with a sudden , quick doubt in [his]0-i voice . '[179-petrovitch] Of course ! ' '[179-petrovitch] [You]179-petrovitch know , do n't [you]179-petrovitch , ' [he]0-i went on eagerly , '[179-petrovitch] that [I]0-i would gladly have given [my]0-i life for [yours]179-petrovitch , and that [I]0-i never hoped for anything so good in [this world]668-this world as to see [you]179-petrovitch alive ? Yes , in spite of everything , though [I]0-i ca n't expect [you]179-petrovitch to believe it , ' [he]0-i ended bitterly . '[0-i] [I]0-i have never doubted it , ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch answered ; and with a sudden thrill of pity for the despair , the remorse , the longing , and the wretchedness in the other 's face , [he]179-petrovitch added , '[0-i] Come , [old friend]2667-old friend , do n't take this so much to heart . It is nothing that can not be put right . [You]179-petrovitch will see when [we]2668-we come to talk it over quietly . Ca n't [we]2668-we have some tea ? ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch knew well enough that when the heart 's cords are stretched almost unbearably by the strain of an intense emotion , it sometimes stems as though they could only be saved from giving way altogether by the direction of the mind to some utterly trivial detail of everyday life . Many [a woman]554-a woman 's heart has been saved from breaking by the necessity of getting [the children]1187-the children 's dinner , and many a tragedy has been averted by [the chief actor]1516-the chief actor 's having to take in the afternoon 's milk . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch repeated the question , '[179-petrovitch] Ca n't [we]2668-we have some tea ? ' [The other]305-the other rose mechanically , went to a cupboard , and brought out a plated kettle and spirit - lamp , a small china tea set , and a plate of lemons , with a silver knife . [He]179-petrovitch put these appliances on the table in an unmethodical , untidy sort of way , and was proceeding to light the spirit - lamp , when [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , who had been watching [him]179-petrovitch with a smile , took the match - box out of [his]179-petrovitch hand . '[179-petrovitch] Here , let [me]0-i make tea . [I]0-i see [you]179-petrovitch are just as unsystematic as ever . ' [He]179-petrovitch lighted the lamp , and with a few deft touches put the rest of the tea - things in order , as [the other]305-the other , leaving the matter in [his]305-the other hands , strode up and down [the room]2910-the room . '[179-petrovitch] Oh , what is to be the end of all this ? ' [he]179-petrovitch said at length ; '[0-i] how long am [I]0-i to go on bearing [your]179-petrovitch name ? ' '[0-i] All this will soon be at an end , as far as [I]0-i am concerned . [I]0-i have nearly completed [my]0-i arrangements for getting back to [Russia]26-russia , and when [I]0-i 'm [there]2994-there [you]179-petrovitch may guess it wo n't matter to [me]305-the other who bears [my]305-the other name . [I]305-the other shall not wish to use it . But while [I]305-the other am here [I]305-the other wish to be [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch . Indeed , [you]179-petrovitch can serve [me]305-the other best by letting it be as widely known as possible that [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff is — well , where [you]179-petrovitch are and not where [I]305-the other am , and after all it 's [nobody]1806-nobody 's business but [yours]179-petrovitch and [mine]305-the other . '[305-the other] ' Does [no one else]4460-no one else know of it at all ? '[305-the other] ' [Only two men in [St Petersburg]27-st petersburg]4461-only two men in st petersburg , and one in [London]6-london . '[305-the other] ' And [he]121-litvinoff is ? '[305-the other] ' [Hirsch]222-hirsch , whom [you]179-petrovitch 've seen , [I]305-the other think . '[305-the other] ' Why the devil did n't [he]121-litvinoff tell [every one]1840-every one then ? '[305-the other] ' Because [I]305-the other asked [him]121-litvinoff not to , and [he]121-litvinoff considers [himself]121-litvinoff under some sort of obligation to [me]305-the other . '[305-the other] ' Like everyone else [you]179-petrovitch come across . But how came [he]121-litvinoff to know it ? '[305-the other] ' [He]121-litvinoff had to be told when [I]305-the other came [here]2895-here . There was certain work [I]305-the other had to do ; [I]305-the other can tell [you]179-petrovitch about it another time , and [he]121-litvinoff was [the only man who could put [me]305-the other in the way of it]4464-the only man who could put me in the way of it . Now [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , the tea is ready . '[305-the other] [The other]305-the other stopped in [his]305-the other walk . ' Curse it ! '[305-the other] [he]305-the other said passionately . ' Call [me]305-the other [a villain]2633-a villain or [a forger]4466-a forger , or any other pretty name [you]179-petrovitch like ; [I]305-the other can stand that , but not [your]179-petrovitch lips calling [me]305-the other by [your]179-petrovitch name . It 's a cruel revenge . '[305-the other] ' Ah , [we]4467-we owe too much to [[our]4467-we enemies]4468-our enemies for there to be any thought of revenge between [friends]2905-friends , and [I]305-the other must teach [myself]305-the other to call [you]179-petrovitch that . Besides , what is there to revenge ? [You]179-petrovitch have only used the name [I]305-the other did not need . '[305-the other] ' No , [I]305-the other forged [your]179-petrovitch name as well as stole it . [You]179-petrovitch do n't know all . '[305-the other] ' Yes , [I]305-the other do , or pretty nearly all . As far as [your]179-petrovitch taking [my]305-the other name goes , that has done no harm ; rather good ; and as for the money , that would have gone to [you]179-petrovitch . [You]179-petrovitch know , if [I]305-the other had had the giving of it , it would have gone to [you]179-petrovitch . And [I]305-the other know [you]179-petrovitch would never have touched it if [you]179-petrovitch had not thought [I]305-the other was dead . '[305-the other] ' [I]305-the other wish [I]305-the other had never left [you]179-petrovitch , though [I]305-the other did think it , and at the mercy of [those curs]4470-those curs . If only [I]305-the other had died by [you]179-petrovitch ! '[305-the other] ' [You]179-petrovitch know well enough [our]4471-us rule is that none should be sacrificed without reason . Why should [you]179-petrovitch have given those hounds two lives instead of one ? '[305-the other] ' [I]305-the other wish [I]305-the other had died that night under the orange trees at [Monte Carlo]90-monte carlo . [You]179-petrovitch did [yourself]179-petrovitch a bad turn when [you]179-petrovitch saved [my]305-the other life . [I]305-the other have done no good with it . [I]305-the other have only weighted [myself]305-the other with unpardonable sins . '[305-the other] ' As far as [I]179-petrovitch am concerned , '[179-petrovitch] [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch said , ' if there is anything to forgive , it is freely forgiven — freely and fully ; and now let [us]4471-us shake hands after [your]179-petrovitch English fashion , and of forgiveness let [us]4471-us talk no more . [We]4471-us are [friends]2905-friends , and between such it is no question of pardon . And there are many other things [we]4471-us must speak of . '[179-petrovitch] [He]179-petrovitch held [his]179-petrovitch hand out , and [the younger man]4449-the younger man grasped it . There was a moment 's pause . Then , — ' Let [me]179-petrovitch give [you]4449-the younger man some fresh tea — that is cold , '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch cheerfully , pouring out another cup ; ' do n't [you]4449-the younger man want to hear what happened to [me]179-petrovitch after [I]179-petrovitch was killed ? '[179-petrovitch] ' [I]305-the other can hardly realise yet that [you]179-petrovitch are not killed . '[305-the other] ' Well , [I]2671-i 'll tell [you]4449-the younger man about it . [The officer of that troop]4473-the officer of that troop added medicine to [his]4473-the officer of that troop other accomplishments , besides which [he]4473-the officer of that troop was [a distant relation of [[my]2671-i mother]1730-my mother 's]4474-a distant relation of my mother 's , and [he]4473-the officer of that troop insisted on seeing whether [I]2671-i could not be conjured back to life . [I]2671-i believe [I]2671-i gave [them]4476-them a good deal of trouble , but [I]2671-i seem to be a die - hard . [My]2671-i capture was kept very quiet , thanks to [my]2671-i family name , for [the Government]38-the government did n't care about having it known that [the head of [the Litvinoffs]225-the litvinoffs]4477-the head of the litvinoffs had tried to atone for the crimes of [[his]4477-the head of the litvinoffs family]1628-his family by taking the side of [the people]407-the people . [My]2671-i wound was a bad one , and even now troubles [me]2671-i sometimes . [I]2671-i used sometimes almost to wish it had settled [me]2671-i . Fancy being in [prison]4072-prison , and [a Russian prison]1554-a russian prison , with a wound like that . '[2671-i] ' But how did [you]2671-i get away ? '[179-petrovitch] For [answer Petrovitch]179-petrovitch told [him]2671-i the story of [his]2671-i escape as [he]2671-i had told it to [Hirsch]222-hirsch and to [[his]2671-i other friends]2672-his other friends , intentionally making the recital a long one , so that [[his]2671-i companion]3423-his companion might have time to get used to the new situation before [they]2674-they began to talk of the future . ' And now , '[2671-i] [he]2671-i said , when [he]2671-i had ended , ' tell [me]2671-i how it fared with [the Secretary]4482-the secretary . '[2671-i] ' [I]2675-the man who had borne the litvinoff name for three years hate to think of it , '[2675-the man who had borne the litvinoff name for three years] said [the man who had borne [the Litvinoff]121-litvinoff name for three years]2675-the man who had borne the litvinoff name for three years , and who , it seemed , was to bear it a little while longer . ' Whenever [I]2671-i think of that night , [I]2671-i see nothing but [your]179-petrovitch face — dead , as [I]2671-i thought — turned up from the snow in the hateful dawn . Oh , [[my]2671-i friend]1506-my friend ! '[2671-i] [his]2671-i voice faltered , and [he]2671-i held [his]2671-i hand out to [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch again . After a pause , [he]2671-i resumed , ' [I]2671-i tried all [I]2671-i knew to revive [you]179-petrovitch , but [you]179-petrovitch were as cold as ice , and [your]179-petrovitch heart did not beat . [I]2671-i stayed by [you]179-petrovitch a long , long time . It did not occur to [me]2671-i to leave [you]179-petrovitch , but at last , in a flash , [I]2671-i realised that [you]179-petrovitch were gone — that [I]2671-i was there in the snow alone . And then [I]2671-i thought of escape . [I]2671-i said good - bye to [your]179-petrovitch body . [I]2671-i felt as if [your]179-petrovitch self was far away somewhere , and then [I]2671-i sprang up and dashed off in the direction [we]4484-we had been taking . It was broad daylight then , but [I]2671-i saw nothing of [the soldiers]4485-the soldiers , though [I]2671-i knew afterwards [they]4485-the soldiers must have found [you]179-petrovitch , because when [we]4484-we sent , [your]179-petrovitch body was gone . [I]2671-i must have kept pretty straight , for [I]2671-i came to [a house]3431-a house at last , and [I]2671-i went straight up to [it]3431-a house . [I]2671-i thought it must be [Teliaboff]277-teliaboff 's , and if it was n't [I]2671-i felt [I]2671-i did n't much care . [I]2671-i went right in , asked for [the master of [the house]291-the house]4487-the master of the house , and when [he]4487-the master of the house came to [me]2671-i [I]2671-i told [him]4487-the master of the house all . It was [Teliaboff]277-teliaboff . [He]277-teliaboff was very good to [me]2671-i , and kept [me]2671-i [there]2994-there nearly a fortnight . [We]4490-we could hear nothing of [you]4491-you — nothing at all . By the way , it was [he]277-teliaboff who first , unconsciously , gave [me]2671-i the idea of personating [you]4491-you , for when [I]2671-i entered [[his]277-teliaboff house]4492-his house on that horrible morning [he]277-teliaboff greeted [me]2671-i by [your]4491-you name . [I]2671-i undeceived [him]277-teliaboff at once , but the idea took root and bore fruit later . [He]277-teliaboff was kindness [itself]277-teliaboff , and [[his]277-teliaboff little daughter]4493-his little daughter — [she]4493-his little daughter was only twelve , [I]2671-i think — took a fancy to [me]2671-i . [I]2671-i believe [that child]4494-that child 's companionship saved [me]2671-i from going mad . '[2671-i] Then [he]2676-he got [me]0-i a passport , and gave [me]0-i money enough to get to [Vienna]70-vienna . When [I]0-i got [there]2994-there [I]0-i was penniless , and [I]0-i knew [you]2678-you had had money there . [I]0-i did not feel somehow that [I]0-i was robbing [you]2678-you when [I]0-i forged [your]2678-you name — Heaven knows that was easily done , [I]0-i knew [your]2678-you signature so well — and went on to [Paris]91-paris with [your]2678-you money as [Count Michael Litvinoff]121-litvinoff . When [I]0-i took [your]2678-you money [I]0-i meant honestly to spend it all in the cause [you]2678-you had worked for , and for a time [I]0-i did . But — [I]0-i do n't know how to explain it — [I]0-i suppose the Revolution had not really taken hold of [me]0-i . It was [you]2678-you [I]0-i had cared for , and [your]2678-you creed [I]0-i had held , not for itself , but because it was [yours]2678-you . And when [your]2678-you personal influence was not near [me]0-i [I]0-i grew careless and idle , and worked for [Liberty]165-liberty only by fits and starts . It used to seem too much trouble to do things for the cause . It had been [your]2678-you approval [I]0-i cared for , [I]0-i think . [You]2678-you are so strong , [I]0-i ca n't expect [you]2678-you to understand the imbecilities of [such a weak fool]2679-such a weak fool as [I]0-i am . From the moment when [I]0-i ceased to spend all [my]0-i time and all [your]2678-you money on [your]2678-you work , [I]0-i seemed utterly degraded in [my]0-i own eyes , and it did not seem to matter what [I]0-i did , so [I]0-i have gone on from bad to worse , and the principles [you]2678-you would die for , have only been will - o'-the - wisp lights to lead [me]0-i into direr troubles than [I]0-i should ever have known without [them]2680-them . [I]0-i have not kept [Michael Litvinoff]121-litvinoff 's name clean . And the evil [I]0-i have done is nothing to what [I]0-i have tried to do . [I]0-i sent [Teliaboff]277-teliaboff [his]277-teliaboff money back , but [I]0-i have never heard from [him]277-teliaboff . Have [you]2678-you ? Do [you]2678-you know whether [he]277-teliaboff is all right ? ' '[2678-you] Have n't [you]2678-you heard ? ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch asked gravely . '[2678-you] Heard ? No ! What ? Anything wrong ? ' '[2678-you] Hanged , ' was the brief reply . '[2678-you] Hanged ! ' '[277-teliaboff] Yes , and [[his]277-teliaboff little daughter]4493-his little daughter — [she]4493-his little daughter was fourteen , then , [I]0-i think — was hanged with [him]277-teliaboff . ' '[0-i] For — for helping [me]0-i ? ' gasped [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff . '[0-i] No , for having " The Prophetic Vision " in [[her]4493-his little daughter room]2996-her room . ' '[0-i] [[My]0-i God]2683-my god ! ' cried [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , springing up . '[0-i] How long will [men]466-men bear it ? Let [us]466-men go back this very day , and kill and kill and kill [these fiends]2685-these fiends as long as [we]466-men have an arm to strike or a finger to pull a trigger . ' '[466-men] [We]466-men are going back , ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch said quietly . '[466-men] As for that deed , it is avenged . [The man who was responsible for that murder]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder got [his]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder sentence of death and [his]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder notice of it two days later . [He]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder lived through three months of terror , and then shot [himself]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder , to escape execution at the hands of [some of [us]466-men]3362-some of us . Do n't talk more of [him]2686-the man who was responsible for that murder . ' [The two men]3340-the two men sat silent for a little while , but [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff 's eyes still blazed with excitement . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch smoked quietly . '[2688-you] How was it , ' [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff asked presently , turning from the other subject with evident effort , '[2688-you] that [you]2688-you did not let [me]0-i know directly [you]2688-you came over ? ' '[2688-you] [I]0-i did not see any good to be gained by it , ' answered [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , who did not choose to tell [[his]179-petrovitch friend]4148-his friend that [he]179-petrovitch had waited to see with what grace [the Prophet]777-the prophet 's Mantle was worn . '[0-i] [I]0-i heard [you]2688-you speak at [the Agora]52-the agora . [I]0-i read [your]2688-you writings . [You]2688-you seemed to be doing good . Besides , it made concealment of [my]0-i purposes more easy not to be known as [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff . ' '[121-litvinoff] Then what made [you]2688-you decide to tell [me]0-i now ? ' was the very natural question . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch hesitated , but only for a moment . Then [he]179-petrovitch said , — '[2688-you] Frankly , because [I]0-i thought [you]2688-you were meditating an action that would afterwards cause [you]2688-you more regret than anything else [you]2688-you have done , and [I]0-i wished to prevent it . ' '[0-i] And that action was ? ' '[0-i] Taking [another wife]2689-another wife while [[your]2688-you first wife]2690-your first wife still lived and still loved [you]2688-you . ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch spoke slowly and distinctly . [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff leaned forward in [his]121-litvinoff chair and looked at [him]121-litvinoff amazedly . '[0-i] By Heaven ! ' [he]121-litvinoff said , leaning back with a sort of sigh , '[0-i] [you]2688-you seem to know everything . ' '[2688-you] [I]0-i have made it [my]0-i business to know . ' '[0-i] Not quite everything in this case , though , ' [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff added , correcting [himself]0-i , '[0-i] for [I]0-i have [no wife]2691-no wife . ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch 's eyes flashed angrily . '[0-i] [I]0-i was not speaking in the phrase of [[your]2688-you London society]2692-your london society . [I]0-i did not suppose that [you]2688-you were going to commit an illegal act . [I]0-i merely imagined that [you]2688-you had intended to commit a crime . [I]0-i am not mistaken in supposing that [you]2688-you always led [the woman in question]2693-the woman in question to believe that [you]2688-you looked upon [her]2693-the woman in question as [[your]2688-you wife]1532-your wife ? ' '[2688-you] [You]2688-you are not mistaken — [you]2688-you are right . [I]0-i did contemplate a crime , ' [he]0-i said , walking over to the bookcase , and standing so that [his]0-i face was not to be seen . '[0-i] [I]0-i have no defence to offer ; but at the time [I]0-i first contemplated it [I]0-i deceived [myself]0-i with the idea that [I]0-i had . But [[my]0-i wife]3047-my wife left [me]0-i . [I]0-i did not leave [her]3047-my wife . [I]0-i never could have left [her]3047-my wife ; and if [she]3047-my wife had not left [me]0-i that vile idea of marrying [another woman]2696-another woman would never have entered [my]0-i head . However , that 's all at an end now , [I]0-i 'm thankful to say , and [I]0-i mean to find [[my]0-i wife'—there]4498-my wife'—there was no hesitation in [his]179-petrovitch voice this time—'and legalise [her]3047-my wife position with bell , book , and candle , and any other rites that may seem to [her]3047-my wife desirable . '[0-i] ' Regardless of principles ? '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , with the faintest possible sneer . ' Damn principles ! '[179-petrovitch] [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff cried , turning round , stung by the tone . ' [I]179-petrovitch would have sacrificed them for [a woman]554-a woman [I]179-petrovitch merely admired , and [they]4500-they sha'n't stand between [me]179-petrovitch and [the woman [I]179-petrovitch love]4501-the woman i love . '[179-petrovitch] ' How do [you]179-petrovitch propose to find [her]3047-my wife ? '[179-petrovitch] ' [I]121-litvinoff have n't the slightest idea . Do [you]179-petrovitch know where [she]3047-my wife is ? '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff added sharply . ' Do [you]179-petrovitch remember giving £ 10 to [a man named [Hirsch]222-hirsch]4502-a man named hirsch in the autumn ? '[121-litvinoff] was the counter - question . ' [I]121-litvinoff do ? '[121-litvinoff] with an inquiring look . ' That was for [[your]179-petrovitch wife]1532-your wife ! '[121-litvinoff] [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff drew a long breath . ' Go on ! '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff said , simply . Then [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch told [him]121-litvinoff all that [he]179-petrovitch knew of [Alice]134-alice , and [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff listened intently . When [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch spoke of the night on [Blackfriars ' Bridge]36-blackfriars ' bridge , [he]179-petrovitch leaned forward breathing heavily , then rose suddenly , and , crossing to a couch , flung [himself]179-petrovitch , face downwards , on it . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch paused . '[179-petrovitch] Go on ! Go on ! Go on ! ' said an impatient , stifled voice from the couch . So [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch resumed . When the tale was told , [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff rose . [He]121-litvinoff was very pale , [his]121-litvinoff lips trembled a little , and [his]121-litvinoff dark eyes were shining and wet . '[179-petrovitch] When can [I]0-i see [you]179-petrovitch to - morrow ? [I]0-i am going to [Chislehurst]80-chislehurst now . [I]0-i do n't thank [you]179-petrovitch ; it would be absurd . Thanks are idiotic under some circumstances . [You]179-petrovitch saved [my]0-i life — which [I]0-i did n't care about — and now it seems [you]179-petrovitch 've saved what [I]0-i do care for , as much as such a scamp as [I]0-i can care for anything . But [you]179-petrovitch do n't need [my]0-i words . [I]0-i believe [you]179-petrovitch understand [me]0-i — if [any one]3772-any one does . ' [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch rose and laid [his]179-petrovitch hand on [his]179-petrovitch shoulder . '[0-i] Do not go to - night , ' [he]179-petrovitch said . '[2698-she] [She]2698-she is not strong yet , and [you]179-petrovitch are too excited to meet [her]2698-she calmly . Wait till to - morrow . [You]179-petrovitch may trust [her]2698-she safely where [she]2698-she is for another night . Besides , there is very , very much to be said between [us]2699-us — both of the past and future . ' '[179-petrovitch] Well , [you]179-petrovitch have a right to command [me]0-i , ' [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff answered , frowning and a little stiffly , and then was silent a moment . Then [he]121-litvinoff said suddenly , flinging [himself]121-litvinoff into [his]121-litvinoff chair with the frown quite gone , '[179-petrovitch] [You]179-petrovitch 're right — [you]179-petrovitch always are , and there is much to be said . [I]179-petrovitch wish to [God]110-god there could be some way of wiping out the past , or rather of atoning for it . Do [you]179-petrovitch know , it seems to [me]179-petrovitch that [I]179-petrovitch shall have a chance of seeing [my]179-petrovitch way to doing something worth doing now [you]179-petrovitch have come back . [I]179-petrovitch could almost swear at this moment that [I]179-petrovitch believed as heartily as ever in liberty , humanity , progress , and all the other things [you]179-petrovitch taught [me]179-petrovitch to swear by , but in [my]179-petrovitch soul [I]179-petrovitch know it is [you]179-petrovitch [I]179-petrovitch believe in — always have believed in — [I]179-petrovitch 've never believed in anything but [you]179-petrovitch for more than three months at a time . Peculiar , is n't it ? '[179-petrovitch] ' [You]179-petrovitch have n't altered in the least , '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch smiling . ' [You]179-petrovitch were never sure of [your]179-petrovitch beliefs except when [you]179-petrovitch were fighting for [them]4504-them . [You]179-petrovitch should be back in [Russia]26-russia . Persecution is a splendid antidote to religious doubt . [Men like [you]179-petrovitch]4505-men like you ought not to live in [England]15-england . There is too much freedom in the air and it does n't agree with [you]179-petrovitch . [You]179-petrovitch get to think there is nothing worth fighting for [here]2895-here . There is , though , and [some Englishmen]4507-some englishmen are beginning to find it out . '[179-petrovitch] ' [You]121-litvinoff are going back to [Russia]26-russia ? '[121-litvinoff] [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff said , interrogatively . ' Yes . '[121-litvinoff] ' Let [me]121-litvinoff come with [you]121-litvinoff , '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff cried , impulsively . ' Give [[your]121-litvinoff Secretary]4508-your secretary another chance . '[121-litvinoff] ' Ah , [my]121-litvinoff days of quiet writing are over now . The battle grows hot . [I]121-litvinoff do n't want [a Secretary]4509-a secretary , [I]121-litvinoff want [a comrade in arms]4510-a comrade in arms . Will [you]121-litvinoff go to [Servia]92-servia for [me]121-litvinoff ? '[121-litvinoff] ' [I]179-petrovitch 'll go to [hell]4511-hell , if [you]121-litvinoff like , '[179-petrovitch] was the direct reply . ' [The two]2933-the two will soon be synonymous , if all [I]179-petrovitch hear is correct . But what about [[your]121-litvinoff wife]1532-your wife ? '[179-petrovitch] ' It used to be one of [your]121-litvinoff principles , '[121-litvinoff] [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff said , using the word , as it were , reluctantly , ' that if [a man]2882-a man believes in anything enough to place [himself]2882-a man in danger for it , [he]2882-a man should not hesitate to risk all [he]2882-a man holds precious for the same end ; and [[my]121-litvinoff wife]3047-my wife is not [a coward]4516-a coward , [she]3047-my wife would go with [me]121-litvinoff . '[121-litvinoff] ' [Poor little woman]4517-poor little woman , '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch ; ' but that was and is one of [my]179-petrovitch principles . If [you]121-litvinoff go to [Servia]92-servia under [my]179-petrovitch name [I]179-petrovitch shall have a far better chance of getting back to [St Petersburg]27-st petersburg under [someone else]402-someone else 's . And the risk to [[your]121-litvinoff wife]1532-your wife is of the slightest , for it is a peaceful errand [I]179-petrovitch will send [you]121-litvinoff on . '[179-petrovitch] ' [I]121-litvinoff hate peaceful errands . '[121-litvinoff] ' [I]121-litvinoff dare say there 'll be a little excitement thrown in — but do n't rush into danger . There is no need there , and it can do no good . [I]121-litvinoff know hard fighting is the easiest ; but [our]4520-our business is to do the thing which has to be done , be it peace or be it war . '[121-litvinoff] ' Ah ! '[121-litvinoff] said [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , with enthusiasm ; ' to act up to that ideal is easy enough for [men like [you]121-litvinoff]4505-men like you , but [you]121-litvinoff must remember that such men as [you]121-litvinoff are as far above the rest of [us]4520-our as [the Christian martyrs]4522-the christian martyrs are above [the average church - goer]4523-the average church - goer . [You]121-litvinoff are [the Saints of the New Religion]4524-the saints of the new religion . '[121-litvinoff] ' Do n't [you]121-litvinoff think [we]4520-our 'd better go and have some dinner ? '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , drily . ' [[MY]179-petrovitch LITTLE GIRL]4525-my little girl . '[179-petrovitch] THE suggestion was a good one , and the dinner to which [the two]2933-the two sat down had a steadying effect on the nerves of [the younger man]4449-the younger man . [He]4449-the younger man became calmer , and when [they]2933-the two returned to [[his]4449-the younger man rooms]2410-his rooms [he]4449-the younger man was able to bear [his]4449-the younger man part in a long , earnest , quiet talk over events past and to come . The talk lasted far into the night , and before [they]2933-the two parted it was settled that [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff should leave for [Servia]92-servia in two days , taking with [him]121-litvinoff certain important papers from [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch to [another of [the Nihilist leaders]2704-the nihilist leaders]2703-another of the nihilist leaders . That [he]121-litvinoff should there wait instructions , and should enter [Russia]26-russia by [the southern frontier]2705-the southern frontier , and rejoin the circle at [St Petersburg]27-st petersburg , leaving [his]121-litvinoff assumed name at [Belgrade]93-belgrade . That the following imaginative announcement should be inserted in as many English papers as possible for the special edification of [the Russian Embassy]2706-the russian embassy . ' [Count Michael Litvinoff]121-litvinoff left [London]6-london for [Dover]94-dover this morning , en route for [Belgrade]93-belgrade . [He]121-litvinoff was accompanied by [Countess Litvinoff]238-countess litvinoff , [an English lady to whom [he]121-litvinoff was secretly married some time ago]4526-an english lady to whom he was secretly married some time ago . [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff , so well known to [many of [[our]4528-our readers]4529-our readers]4527-many of our readers through [his]121-litvinoff " Social Enigma , " [his]121-litvinoff " Hopes and Fears for Liberty , " and [his]121-litvinoff many revolutionary brochures , has never been [a familiar figure in [London]6-london society]4530-a familiar figure in london society , [his]121-litvinoff literary labours having compelled [him]121-litvinoff to live in strict retirement . It will be remembered that [he]121-litvinoff was the hero of an adventure on [the Russian frontier]4531-the russian frontier some years ago , was wounded , captured , and sent to [a Russian prison]1554-a russian prison , from which [he]121-litvinoff escaped to [England]15-england . '[179-petrovitch] It was also settled that the money for the journey should be taken from [the remainder of [the Litvinoff capital]2708-the litvinoff capital]2707-the remainder of the litvinoff capital . When [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff began to speak of the money [he]121-litvinoff had spent and the debts [he]121-litvinoff had incurred , [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch stopped [him]121-litvinoff with , — ' [I]179-petrovitch 'll see to [your]121-litvinoff debts — and what is gone is gone . Do n't let [us]2710-they waste words over that . '[179-petrovitch] It was arranged that [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch should seek out [John Hatfield]135-john hatfield and [[his]135-john hatfield wife]522-his wife , and should let [them]2710-they know that [[their]2710-they daughter]2711-their daughter was happily married . [They]2710-they judged it best not to subject [Alice]134-alice to an interview which could not but involve most painful explanations , and [they]2710-they agreed that it would be cruel both to [her]134-alice and to [[her]134-alice parents]3533-her parents to let [them]2713-them meet , merely to part again at once . Of [Clare Stanley]139-clare neither of [them]2713-them spoke one word . A new day was some way into its small hours when [they]2713-them said good - bye . ' [We]2713-them meet in [St Petersburg]27-st petersburg , then , as soon as may be , '[179-petrovitch] [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch said . ' [I]179-petrovitch shall not see [you]139-clare again till then . '[179-petrovitch] ' [I]305-the other hope by that time [I]305-the other shall have done something to prove to [you]139-clare that [you]139-clare have indeed brought [me]305-the other back to the ranks of duty and the Revolution . '[305-the other] ' [I]305-the other do n't need proof , '[305-the other] said [the other]305-the other with one last hand - pressure . And so [they]2713-them parted . Next morning early , [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff went down into [the City]3372-the city , where [he]121-litvinoff paid a disproportionate sum of money for a paper which empowered [him]121-litvinoff to marry [[his]121-litvinoff wife]522-his wife at once , instead of waiting three weeks for that privilege . Then [he]121-litvinoff went down to [Chislehurst]80-chislehurst . The sky was clear and pale and blue , and the sun shone divinely . The trees that had been brown seemed at a little distance to be wrapped in a grey gauze veil , as they always do when the green buds first break out to new life . As [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff walked up [the hill]1476-the hill to [Chislehurst Common]95-chislehurst common , [he]121-litvinoff tried to think what [he]121-litvinoff should say to [Alice]134-alice , how [she]134-alice would look , how [she]134-alice would speak to [him]121-litvinoff . With a touch of ingrained cynicism , [he]121-litvinoff laughed at [himself]121-litvinoff to find that [his]121-litvinoff heart was beating tumultuously , and that [his]121-litvinoff hands were trembling . ' And this is [the man]3262-the man , '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff said contemptuously to [himself]121-litvinoff , ' who walked behind [her]134-alice for half - an - hour last autumn , and never spoke to [her]134-alice ! No , not [the same man]4092-the same man , '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff added , after a pause , ' [I]121-litvinoff am purged of a crime since then . '[121-litvinoff] [The house where [he]121-litvinoff was to seek [Alice]134-alice]2718-the house where he was to seek alice was [a little yellow - brick building near [the church]2720-the church]2719-a little yellow - brick building near the church . [He]121-litvinoff looked at [the pretty old - fashioned churchyard]2721-the pretty old - fashioned churchyard as [he]121-litvinoff passed , and then at [the building]2576-the building [itself]2576-the building . ' [I]121-litvinoff suppose , '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff said to it , ' [you]4535-you will be the balm [the child]1113-the child will choose to ease [her]1113-the child sorrow — and [you]4535-you will bring comfort to [her]1113-the child , as [you]4535-you have to [thousands of [others]658-others]4537-thousands of others . [I]121-litvinoff do n't grudge [them]4537-thousands of others [their]4537-thousands of others comfort , but [I]121-litvinoff do grudge [you]4535-you [your]4535-you influence . However , [you]4535-you wo n't keep it much longer . [Tant mieux]278-tant mieux . '[121-litvinoff] [His]121-litvinoff hand was on the garden gate — [he]121-litvinoff unlatched it , and walked up to [the smallest detached house]2723-the smallest detached house [he]121-litvinoff had ever beheld . [He]121-litvinoff raised the diminutive knocker , and assaulted therewith the tiny brown door . Would [she]2724-she open it ? [She]2724-she did not . [It]2725-it opened — and [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff at first really thought [it]2725-it opened of its own accord . At anyrate it opened by some agency invisible to [him]121-litvinoff . [He]121-litvinoff stood and looked ; but when the door slowly began to close again , [he]121-litvinoff thought it was time for action . [He]121-litvinoff came a step forward , and addressing nothing , said , — ' Is [Mrs Litvinoff]180-litvinoff in ? '[121-litvinoff] Then [a very small girl in a yellow pinafore and a lilac frock]2726-a very small girl in a yellow pinafore and a lilac frock showed [herself]2726-a very small girl in a yellow pinafore and a lilac frock from behind the door ; but shyness and an incomplete knowledge of [her]2726-a very small girl in a yellow pinafore and a lilac frock native tongue combined to render [her]2726-a very small girl in a yellow pinafore and a lilac frock speechless . [Litvinoff]180-litvinoff , with an impatient but perfectly gentle movement , lifted [her]2724-she bodily from [her]2724-she position as guard , and placed [her]2724-she outside the door . ' The air will brighten [your]2724-she wits , [mon petit chou]4539-mon petit chou , '[121-litvinoff] [he]121-litvinoff said . Then [he]121-litvinoff walked straight into [the house]291-the house , and looked round [the two rooms on the ground floor]2728-the two rooms on the ground floor . Empty . [He]121-litvinoff passed through [the kitchen]2729-the kitchen , whose proportions would have served for those of [the corresponding apartment in [a good - sized doll 's house]2731-a good - sized doll 's house]2730-the corresponding apartment in a good - sized doll 's house , and found [himself]121-litvinoff in [a brick - paved back yard]2732-a brick - paved back yard , where there were a water - butt , a basket of wet linen , some clothes - lines , and [the lady of [the house]291-the house]2733-the lady of the house . Regardless of [her]2724-she astonishment , [he]121-litvinoff addressed [himself]121-litvinoff to [her]2724-she . ' Oh , [Mrs Litvinoff]180-litvinoff ? '[2724-she] [she]2724-she answered curiously , ' [she]2724-she is out ; [she]2724-she has gone to [Orpington]96-orpington for some butter for [me]2724-she , [sir]318-sir , and [she]2724-she wo n't be long . '[2724-she] ' How long ? '[3264-the woman] ' Perhaps an hour . '[2733-the lady of the house] ' Is [she]2724-she alone ? '[2724-she] ' Yes , [sir]318-sir . '[3264-the woman] ' If [you]318-sir 'll be kind enough to tell [me]3264-the woman the way , [I]3264-the woman think [I]3264-the woman 'll go and meet [her]2724-she . '[3264-the woman] ' And who shall [I]2724-she say called if [you]318-sir should miss [her]2724-she , and [she]2724-she comes back first ? '[2724-she] ' Say [[her]2724-she husband]1245-her husband , '[180-litvinoff] answered [Litvinoff]180-litvinoff . [The woman]3264-the woman gave [him]2736-he profuse directions , for which [he]2736-he thanked [her]3264-the woman with [his]2736-he usual empressement , and turned at the gate to raise [his]2736-he hat in farewell . ' [[My]279-mrs bowen stars]4543-my stars ! '[279-mrs bowen] said [Mrs Bowen]279-mrs bowen , as [she]279-mrs bowen watched [him]2736-he out of sight , ' [he]2736-he 's [a real gentleman]4544-a real gentleman , and no mistake . [Poor little Mrs Litvinoff]180-litvinoff , '[279-mrs bowen] [she]279-mrs bowen added , with [a woman]554-a woman 's instinctive interest in a romance , ' [I]279-mrs bowen hope [they]4545-they 'll make it up and live happy ever after , that [I]279-mrs bowen do ! '[279-mrs bowen] [Litvinoff]180-litvinoff walked along . [His]2736-he heart was lighter than it had been for many a long day . On these delicious fresh spring mornings — When [March]280-march makes sweet the weatherWith daffodil , and starling , And hours of fruitful breath , just to be alive is a rapture . Of course it may be cancelled by care like any other joy . But [Litvinoff]180-litvinoff felt as if [he]2736-he had no cares . [He]2736-he was going to meet [the woman [he]2736-he loved]4425-the woman he loved , and the nearer [he]2736-he got to [her]4425-the woman he loved the more [he]2736-he loved [her]4425-the woman he loved . In love , as in friendship , nearness was everything to [him]2736-he . Every figure in the distance [he]2736-he thought was [her]4425-the woman he loved figure . If [you]2739-you have ever gone to meet [a person whom [you]2739-you very intensely wished to meet]2740-a person whom you very intensely wished to meet , [you]2739-you will remember how constantly recurring is that illusion . [You]2739-you will remember the spasm of vindictive hate which seizes on [you]2739-you when [the figure in the distance]2741-the figure in the distance is neared , and dispels [your]2739-you illusion by being itself and not the one [you]2739-you wanted it to be . [Paul]281-paul 's [Cray Common]97-cray common seemed a paradise to [him]2736-he . It does make a fairly good one under favourable circumstances , with [its]97-cray common heather , and gorse , and larch , and oak saplings , and , fairest of all , [its]97-cray common graceful swaying silver birches . The birds were singing madly , and as [he]2736-he felt the springy turf under [his]2736-he feet , and the warm spring sun on [his]2736-he shoulders , [he]2736-he began to sing , too , a tender little French song , all about green woodland paths , and youth , and love , and happiness . [Alice Hatfield]134-alice 's heart was very sad , but it was a quiet sadness , that did not shut out the charm of the spring . Under the influence of the young life blood of the year that seemed to be throbbing through that perfect day , [she]134-alice had felt strong , and had walked with more swiftness than usual , and now , as [she]134-alice was returning with a basket , in which [her]134-alice butter lay , under cool green leaves , [she]134-alice began to walk more slowly and to consider two pounds of butter heavier than [she]134-alice had thought it before . [She]134-alice had been revelling among the primroses and dog violets , and had filled up [her]134-alice basket with the pale , yellow primrose stars and the delicate pink and white wind - flowers . [She]134-alice was tired , certainly , and [she]134-alice turned aside and sat down on a felled tree , in [a certain little pine copse that runs along by [the road]3300-the road - side]2742-a certain little pine copse that runs along by the road - side . The pine needles lay brown , and soft , and thick under [her]134-alice feet . A little bright - eyed , red - brown squirrel came half - way down one of the trees to look at [her]134-alice , but seemed to find [her]134-alice not quite as nice as [he]2736-he had expected , for [he]2736-he whisked [his]2736-he tail with undisguised contempt , and went back to [[his]2736-he home]3710-his home with a lightning - like spiral scramble . [He]2736-he must have been a squirrel hard to please , for it is a fact that , in spite of illness and trouble , [Alice]134-alice was far prettier now than when [her]134-alice sweet face had first caught [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff 's eyes on [the Birkenhead Ferry]98-the birkenhead ferry . [She]134-alice sat quietly gazing through the pine trees , with [her]134-alice head turned from [the road]3300-the road . Presently [she]134-alice stooped to attempt the capture of a very young and very yellow frog which had hopped close to [her]134-alice feet , regardless of the pine needles . As [she]134-alice did so [her]134-alice heart stood still , for [her]134-alice ears caught the tramp , tramp of [a man]2882-a man 's footstep , and the ringing sound of [a man]2882-a man 's voice , a voice [she]134-alice knew , — ' Viens , [suivons les sentiers ombreux]4546-suivons les sentiers ombreux , Ou s'égarent les amoureuxLe printemps nous appelle , Viens ! Soyons heureux ! '[2882-a man] [She]134-alice rose to [her]134-alice feet , and involuntarily uttered a low cry . [She]134-alice dared not turn [her]134-alice head . The singing stopped abruptly , there was a crash through the brambles , and in a moment a pair of strong arms were round [her]134-alice , and lips close to [her]134-alice ear murmured , — ' [[My]134-alice little girl]4525-my little girl ! '[134-alice] [She]134-alice rested on [his]2882-a man arm for one moment Then [she]134-alice said , in a choked sort of voice , as [she]134-alice tried to release [herself]134-alice , — ' It 's no use , [I]134-alice can not come back . [You]2882-a man have not come here to ask [me]134-alice back . Do , do leave [me]134-alice alone ! '[134-alice] [He]2882-a man held [her]134-alice fast . ' [[My]2882-a man darling]4548-my darling , '[2882-a man] [he]2882-a man whispered , ' do [you]4548-my darling think [I]2882-a man could leave [you]4548-my darling now [I]2882-a man have found [you]4548-my darling ? [I]2882-a man have come to ask [you]4548-my darling to come back to [me]2882-a man . [I]2882-a man have come to ask [you]4548-my darling to marry [me]2882-a man . [You]4548-my darling will not send [me]2882-a man away . [I]2882-a man can not do without [[my]2882-a man little one]4434-my little one any longer . [You]4548-my darling love [me]2882-a man still ? '[2882-a man] [he]2882-a man added , a sudden doubt striking [him]2882-a man at [her]2748-her continued silence , and [he]2882-a man raised [her]2748-her chin with [his]2882-a man hand till [he]2882-a man could look in [her]2748-her face . [She]2748-her shrank from [his]2882-a man hand , and hid [her]2748-her face against [his]2882-a man neck . ' [You]2882-a man know , '[2748-her] [she]2748-her answered , ' [you]2882-a man know . '[2748-her] So it came about that [Alice]134-alice married [her]134-alice love who had not been true , and forgave [him]2882-a man with all [her]134-alice heart ; when [she]134-alice was leaving [the church]2720-the church , leaning on [[her]134-alice husband]1245-her husband 's arm , with a new world of love and joy opening before [her]134-alice , and [Litvinoff]121-litvinoff was looking down at [her]134-alice with eyes in which love deepened every moment , [[her]134-alice father]391-her father lay dead at the bottom of the tank in [Thornsett Mill]13-thornsett mill . [The Litvinoffs]225-the litvinoffs left [England]15-england at once , and to this day [Alice]134-alice does not know of [[her]134-alice father]391-her father 's death , and [[her]134-alice husband]1245-her husband does not know of the dire disaster that followed on [his]1245-her husband double dealing . [I]0-i doubt if [they]2754-they will ever learn it now . There is a good deal more that [Alice]134-alice does not know . It is perhaps as well . [Wives]2755-wives are none the happier for knowing too much of [[their]2755-wives husbands]1930-their husbands ' past . As it is , [Alice]134-alice will follow [him]1245-her husband to [the world]2867-the world 's end , believing in [him]1245-her husband unquestioningly . '[2755-wives] [Cannon Street Hotel]99-cannon street hotel , 9.30 p.m. [DEAR MR PETROVITCH,—We]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we were married this morning at [St Nicholas Cole Abbey]100-st nicholas cole abbey , and [we]2757-we are leaving [London]6-london by the night mail . [I]0-i can not go without thanking [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we with [my]0-i whole heart for all [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we have done for [me]0-i — for [both of [us]2757-we]2758-both of us . No words can ever tell [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we how much [I]0-i feel what [we]2757-we owe to [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we . [[My]0-i husband]2759-my husband says [he]2759-my husband owes more to [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we than [I]0-i do , but [I]0-i can not think that . Good - bye until [we]2757-we see [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we in [Russia]26-russia . Oh ! Heaven bless [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we , [Mr Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , for all [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we have done for [us.—Yours]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we always gratefully , [Alice Litvinoff]283-alice . ' In the same envelope was a letter from [[Alice]283-alice 's husband]4551-alice 's husband , and it did not begin in the same way as [hers]283-alice . It ran thus , — '[283-alice] [[My]0-i dear]362-my dear [Litvinoff,—I]284-litvinoff,—i ca n't write to [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we under any but [your]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we own name , nor can [I]0-i sign any other than [my]0-i own . [I]0-i kept [yours]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we as [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we wished , and [Alice]283-alice believes [herself]283-alice to be [Countess Litvinoff]238-countess litvinoff . [I]0-i shall tell [her]283-alice all that part of [my]0-i story later , but [I]0-i shall never tell [her]283-alice of [my]0-i villainous and insensate desire for [a rich wife]2761-a rich wife , and for a life of ease which would have driven [me]0-i mad in three months . [Alice]283-alice and a life of adventure are worth all the broad acres in creation . Nor shall [I]0-i tell [her]283-alice that [I]0-i knew [[her]283-alice father]391-her father . One thing more [I]0-i must ask [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we to do for [me]0-i . Write to [Richard Ferrier]130-richard and let [him]130-richard know that [we]2763-we are married . [I]0-i think [I]0-i 've used [him]130-richard rather badly . [Alice]283-alice wishes [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we to say good - bye for [her]283-alice to [[her]283-alice good friends]2764-her good friends Mr and [Mrs Toomey]191-mrs toomey . Some kind fate certainly kept watch over [[my]0-i wife]3047-my wife while [I]0-i was playing [the fool]2766-the fool and dangling after [another woman]2696-another woman . And Fate has been a thousand times better to [me]0-i than [I]0-i deserve . With [[my]0-i dear wife]2768-my dear wife , and the prospect of meeting [you]282-dear mr petrovitch,—we soon in [Russia]26-russia , [I]0-i feel all the old enthusiasm re - awakening . Vive la Révolution!—Your old secretary and [friend]2769-friend , [Armand Percival]276-percival . ' In signing that name [I]276-percival feel as though [I]276-percival were writing with [my]276-percival left hand , it is so awkward to [me]276-percival after all these years . '[276-percival] [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch sighed as [he]179-petrovitch replaced the letters in [their]2770-their envelope . [He]179-petrovitch had given [himself]179-petrovitch up wholly to the cause [he]179-petrovitch served , and [he]179-petrovitch had suffered for it , and was prepared to suffer more , and generally [he]179-petrovitch was contented , even glad , that it should be so . But sometimes a sudden sense of the utter loneliness of [his]179-petrovitch life came over [him]179-petrovitch , saddening and oppressing [him]179-petrovitch . Then [he]179-petrovitch seemed to [himself]179-petrovitch to be not [a man with a life of [his]179-petrovitch own to live and hopes of [his]179-petrovitch own]2771-a man with a life of his own to live and hopes of his own to cherish , but [a power passing through the lives of [others]658-others , helping , guiding , saving , and always after a while fading out of those lives]2772-a power passing through the lives of others , helping , guiding , saving , and always after a while fading out of those lives . [He]179-petrovitch had brought [these two]2267-these two together , and [they]2267-these two were all in all to [each other]2934-each other , and [he]179-petrovitch was much to [them]2267-these two perhaps , but mainly because [he]179-petrovitch had brought [them]2267-these two together . Now [he]179-petrovitch felt that [they]2267-these two were lost to [him]179-petrovitch , and [he]179-petrovitch had loved [them]2267-these two both — [Alice]283-alice with the love of [a strong man]2776-a strong man for [a child]484-a child , and the other with a deep attachment which dated from the first moment of [their]2267-these two meeting , and which had unaccountably withstood all the other 's shortcomings . Unaccountably ? No ? the essence of love is its boundless capacity for pardon ; the unaccountable part of it was that [he]179-petrovitch should ever have loved [him]179-petrovitch at all . And [they]2267-these two were gone ; and gone , as [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch knew well enough , to begin a life whose end , sooner or later , must be the scaffold or the death - in - life of perpetual imprisonment . [He]179-petrovitch had led [many a man]2778-many a man and [many a woman]2779-many a woman into that path , knowing all that it meant , and [he]179-petrovitch was not sorry . Was it not the path [he]179-petrovitch had [himself]179-petrovitch chosen as being the noblest that [any man]2780-any man 's feet could tread — the path of utter self - renunciation ? But though [he]179-petrovitch was never sorry [he]179-petrovitch was often sad , and sadder than usual on the day when [[his]179-petrovitch two friends]1474-his two friends bade farewell to safety and [English soil]2782-english soil . [He]179-petrovitch felt lonely and desolate . But [Michael Petrovitch]179-petrovitch never felt [his]179-petrovitch own moral pulse for more than half a minute at a time . [He]179-petrovitch sighed , raised [his]179-petrovitch hand to [his]179-petrovitch chin , and smiled at finding [himself]179-petrovitch reminded that the gesture of passing [his]179-petrovitch hand over [his]179-petrovitch beard , which had grown into a settled habit with [him]179-petrovitch in moments of annoyance or excitement , was no longer possible . [He]179-petrovitch turned to [his]179-petrovitch table and wrote half - a - dozen letters . There were many arrangements still to make for [his]179-petrovitch journey . Then [he]179-petrovitch rose , put on [his]179-petrovitch hat , and started for [Marlborough Villa]69-marlborough villa . [He]179-petrovitch had not cared to face that dinner where [he]179-petrovitch was to have met [[his]179-petrovitch fellow revolutionist]2783-his fellow revolutionist . [He]179-petrovitch had written a hasty note of excuse , and had spent the evening and the best part of the night in conference with [[his]179-petrovitch morose friend]2784-his morose friend [Hirsch]222-hirsch , who was a little more morose even than usual on this occasion , owing to what [he]179-petrovitch thought the absurd and unjust leniency with which [the pseudo Litvinoff]283-alice had been treated . [He]179-petrovitch would have been much better satisfied had some sudden and awful judgment overtaken [the adventurer who had dared to personate [[his]179-petrovitch hero]2786-his hero]2785-the adventurer who had dared to personate his hero — even had that judgment come in the form of a trial for forgery at [the Old Bailey]2787-the old bailey ; which fact showed that [he]179-petrovitch was but [a weaker brother in the faith that teaches that crime is a disease to be cured]2788-a weaker brother in the faith that teaches that crime is a disease to be cured , not an offence to be punished . In that conversation with [Hirsch]222-hirsch the date of [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch 's departure had been finally settled , and now [he]179-petrovitch had a few farewell visits to pay . [One]504-one must certainly be to [Mrs Quaid]201-mrs quaid — [he]179-petrovitch had a fancy that [he]179-petrovitch would try to make [his]179-petrovitch parting with [Miss Stanley]122-miss stanley something more than it could be in the presence of [that estimable lady]2790-that estimable lady . [He]179-petrovitch thought that [Clare]139-clare would not hesitate to say good - bye to [him]179-petrovitch without [[her]139-clare hostess]2791-her hostess 's surveillance . At any rate , a chance of being alone with [her]139-clare to say [his]179-petrovitch farewell was what [he]179-petrovitch was bent on trying for . At [Marlborough Villa]69-marlborough villa [he]179-petrovitch was shown into [the morning - room]2792-the morning - room . [It]2792-the morning - room was empty , but in a moment [Clare]139-clare came in . [He]179-petrovitch was standing with [his]179-petrovitch back to the window . When [she]139-clare saw [him]179-petrovitch [she]139-clare started visibly , and , with an unmistakable gesture of annoyance , was turning to leave [the room]2910-the room , when [he]179-petrovitch made a step forward , and [she]139-clare paused and looked at [him]179-petrovitch , and , turning with a complete change of expression , held out [her]139-clare hand . ' How could [I]139-clare have been so absurd ? '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said . ' Do [you]179-petrovitch know for the moment [I]139-clare really thought it was [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff . '[139-clare] ' [I]139-clare do n't wonder at [your]179-petrovitch not quite recognising [me]139-clare . [You]179-petrovitch see [I]139-clare had to sacrifice [my]139-clare beard . [I]139-clare am going back to [Russia]26-russia next week . Disguise will be de rigeur , and beards and disguises are incompatible . '[139-clare] ' Going back to [Russia]26-russia next week ? '[139-clare] [she]139-clare repeated slowly , ' and [I]139-clare had so much to say — to ask — '[139-clare] ' Do [you]139-clare still need advice ? '[179-petrovitch] [he]179-petrovitch said , smiling . ' Yes , '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said , speaking quickly and eagerly , ' more than ever , for now [I]139-clare have made up [my]139-clare mind . [I]139-clare am quite certain that [my]139-clare money ought to go — not to simply alleviating the miseries that wring [one]504-one 's heart , but to helping to overthrow the system that causes [them]4553-them . [I]139-clare have felt it a strong temptation to help first the individual sorrows that [I]139-clare know of ; but [I]139-clare know that the right thing to do is to help not those , but the revolution that will render [them]4553-them impossible . [I]139-clare am right , am [I]139-clare not ? '[139-clare] ' Yes , '[179-petrovitch] [he]179-petrovitch answered . [They]2794-they were standing by the window . This was not the sort of thing that [one]504-one settles comfortably into chairs to ' talk over . '[139-clare] ' But now [you]179-petrovitch are going , '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said , with a saddened falling cadence in [her]139-clare voice , that made music for [the man at [her]139-clare side]2796-the man at her side , ' and [I]139-clare shall have [no one]494-no one to tell [me]139-clare what to do . Why need [you]179-petrovitch go ? Is there nothing for [you]179-petrovitch to do here ? Is [Russia]26-russia so dear that it pushes all other claims out of sight ? '[139-clare] ' It is not that [I]139-clare am [a patriot]4555-a patriot . [I]139-clare love [Russia]26-russia , [I]139-clare love [[my]139-clare people]4556-my people , but [I]139-clare love [England]15-england and [[her]15-england people]3294-her people too . But better than either do [I]139-clare love [Liberty]165-liberty , and [I]139-clare must be where [[her]165-liberty enemies]4558-her enemies are strongest , where the battle is hottest . '[139-clare] ' If that is so , '[2797-she] [she]2797-she said , reflectively , with [her]2797-she eyes downcast , ' everyone who loves [Liberty]165-liberty best should be in front of the battle too ? '[2797-she] ' [I]2798-you think so ; but [each]2273-each must think for [himself]2273-each , '[2798-you] [he]2798-you was beginning , when [they]2799-they both turned at the sudden opening of the door . [Cora Quaid]236-cora came in ; [her]236-cora fresh face quite pale ; a newspaper in [her]236-cora hands . ' Oh , how do [you]2798-you do , [Mr Petrovitch]179-petrovitch . [I]236-cora did not know [you]2798-you were [here]2895-here . [Clare]139-clare , such a terrible thing has happened , [dear]364-dear ; [mamma]2210-mamma has just seen it in the paper . '[236-cora] [She]236-cora held out the sheet and pointed to a paragraph headed , ' Shocking accident at [Firth Vale]11-firth vale . '[236-cora] The paragraph told briefly of the death of [Richard Ferrier]130-richard , and of the discovery of [Hatfield]134-alice 's body in the great tank , and concluded thus : ' [The brother of [the deceased]4564-the deceased]4563-the brother of the deceased , [Mr Richard Ferrier]130-richard , states that [[his]130-richard brother]2917-his brother went out for a stroll on the previous night in [his]2917-his brother usual spirits . There is no clue to any explanation of the catastrophe , save that [the man [Hatfield]134-alice was formerly employed in [this mill]3985-this mill]4566-the man hatfield was formerly employed in this mill , and had been heard to say that [he]2917-his brother considered [himself]2917-his brother personally aggrieved at the closing of it . [He]2917-his brother was supposed to be in [the south of [England]15-england]4568-the south of england , and it is rumoured that [he]2917-his brother secretly returned to wreak vengeance on [the young masters of [the mill]2936-the mill]4569-the young masters of the mill for the part [they]4569-the young masters of the mill had taken in closing it . '[139-clare] [Clare]139-clare read it through ; [her]139-clare face grew white , and [she]139-clare passed it to [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch . [He]179-petrovitch read it silently , [his]179-petrovitch brow contracting . When [he]179-petrovitch laid the paper down [he]179-petrovitch looked at [Clare]139-clare . [She]139-clare had sunk into a chair , [her]139-clare arms stretched out over [her]139-clare knees to their full length , and [her]139-clare hands clasped . ' [Poor fellow]4571-poor fellow ! poor [Dick]106-dick ! '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said ; ' but , oh , [Cora]236-cora ! poor [Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield ! How will [she]141-mrs hatfield bear it ? Oh ! how cruel life is to [some people]998-some people . First [[her]141-mrs hatfield daughter]1329-her daughter , and now [[her]141-mrs hatfield husband]1245-her husband , and [she]141-mrs hatfield is alone in some strange place , where [no one]494-no one can get to [her]141-mrs hatfield to help [her]141-mrs hatfield to bear it ! '[139-clare] ' How could [you]2800-i help [her]141-mrs hatfield if [you]2800-i knew where [she]141-mrs hatfield was ? '[179-petrovitch] asked [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch . ' [I]2800-i could tell [her]141-mrs hatfield [myself]2800-i . [I]2800-i have had grief to bear — [I]2800-i know , '[2800-i] [she]2800-i answered . ' [I]2800-i would save [her]141-mrs hatfield from hearing it from [some careless stranger]4576-some careless stranger . [I]2800-i could go to [her]141-mrs hatfield — '[2800-i] [She]2800-i broke off . [Her]2800-i hazel eyes were full of tears . [Cora]236-cora laid [her]236-cora hand on [[her]236-cora friend]4084-her friend 's shoulder with a sympathetic touch . ' [I]179-petrovitch happen to know where [this Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield is , '[179-petrovitch] said [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , reflectively , ' and [I]179-petrovitch agree with [you]139-clare , [Miss Stanley]122-miss stanley , that it would be right for [you]139-clare to go to [her]141-mrs hatfield . '[179-petrovitch] [Clare]139-clare rose instantly . As [she]139-clare did so the tears brimmed over , and two fell from [her]139-clare long lashes . [Cora]236-cora looked at [him]179-petrovitch a little curiously . ' [We]4081-the two girls had better speak to [mamma]2210-mamma , [I]236-cora think , '[236-cora] [she]236-cora said ; ' perhaps [we]4081-the two girls can come with [you]139-clare , [Clare]139-clare . '[236-cora] [The two girls]4081-the two girls left [the room]2910-the room , and [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , for once , did not take up a book , but stood rapt in thought through the ten minutes that passed before the door opened again . [Clare]139-clare came in alone . [She]139-clare was still dressed in black , of course , and had a little close crape bonnet that seemed to enhance the prettiness of the face it framed . ' [I]139-clare am quite ready , '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said . ' [Mrs Quaid]201-mrs quaid and [Cora]236-cora can not come . [They]4081-the two girls have [some people]998-some people coming to lunch , and [I]139-clare am not sorry , for poor [Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield ought not to be bothered by [strangers]1420-strangers . '[139-clare] ' Come , then , '[179-petrovitch] [he]179-petrovitch said , and [they]4081-the two girls went out together . As soon as [they]4081-the two girls were outside [he]179-petrovitch offered [her]139-clare [his]179-petrovitch arm , as a matter of course , and [she]139-clare took it . ' How did [you]179-petrovitch know [her]141-mrs hatfield address ? '[139-clare] asked [Clare]139-clare , as [they]4081-the two girls walked along . ' Ah ! that involves explanations , '[179-petrovitch] [he]179-petrovitch answered ; ' to begin with , [I]179-petrovitch must tell [you]139-clare that [I]179-petrovitch met [Count Litvinoff]121-litvinoff two days ago . It was from [him]121-litvinoff [I]179-petrovitch had [Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield 's address . '[179-petrovitch] ' [I]179-petrovitch remember [he]121-litvinoff and poor [Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield used to be [friends]2905-friends . '[179-petrovitch] ' [He]121-litvinoff gave [me]139-clare the address for a special reason and for a special purpose . [He]121-litvinoff has married [Alice Hatfield]134-alice , and [he]121-litvinoff wished to let [[her]134-alice people]3294-her people know . '[139-clare] ' [Alice Hatfield]134-alice ! But — how long ago ? How did [he]121-litvinoff know [her]134-alice ? '[139-clare] ' [He]121-litvinoff married [her]134-alice yesterday , and [they]4582-they have gone to [Servia]92-servia together . Then [she]139-clare went on , ' But [he]121-litvinoff acted as though [he]121-litvinoff believed [Roland]107-roland had taken [her]134-alice away . Oh , how could [he]121-litvinoff have been so base and — '[139-clare] ' Do not judge [him]121-litvinoff , '[179-petrovitch] [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch interrupted ; ' [no one]494-no one knows how [he]121-litvinoff may have been tempted , and [he]121-litvinoff has repented and atoned for [his]121-litvinoff fault in as far as [he]121-litvinoff could . '[179-petrovitch] ' There are some things that can not be atoned for , '[139-clare] said [Clare]139-clare , compressing [her]139-clare lips . ' If it had not been for [him]121-litvinoff this tragedy would never have happened . Oh , when [I]139-clare think — '[139-clare] [She]139-clare broke off suddenly .
