Is it not so ? '[139-clare] [She]139-clare looked at [him]179-petrovitch in mute inquiry . How did [he]179-petrovitch know so much ? ' Years ago , '[179-petrovitch] [he]179-petrovitch said , ' [he]121-litvinoff and [I]179-petrovitch were [friends]2905-friends , and [I]179-petrovitch love [him]121-litvinoff still . [He]121-litvinoff has told [me]179-petrovitch much that has happened since last autumn . And [I]179-petrovitch say , judge [no man]1917-no man 's actions , for of [his]121-litvinoff temptations [you]139-clare can not judge . '[179-petrovitch] Then [they]2804-they were both silent , and when [Clare]139-clare spoke again it was to inquire how [the trains]2805-the trains went , and so on . ' [I]139-clare wish [you]2807-you would tell [me]139-clare — '[139-clare] [Clare]139-clare began , when [they]2804-they were in [the train]1421-the train en route for [Dartford]78-dartford . ' There is much [I]2807-you would wish to tell [you]139-clare , '[2807-you] [he]2807-you interrupted , ' but not to - day , when [you]139-clare are going on an errand of kindness and mercy . [You]139-clare do not want to talk now , [you]139-clare want to think ; and besides , [I]2807-you want to see [you]139-clare again . Will [you]139-clare write to [me]2807-you to - night , and tell [me]2807-you when and where [I]2807-you can see [you]139-clare alone to - morrow . '[2807-you] ' Yes , if [you]2807-you wish it , '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said . ' [I]139-clare had so much to ask [you]2807-you ; and just now it seems as though [I]139-clare could think of nothing but [that man]4587-that man , lying dead far north , and [[his]4587-that man poor wife]4588-his poor wife here alone . '[139-clare] ' Then it is a promise . [We]4589-we are [comrades]4590-comrades , since [we]4589-we serve in the same ranks ; and between [comrades]4590-comrades a special farewell is necessary . Now , [we]4589-we will not talk , since [you]2807-you do not desire it . '[139-clare] [Clare]139-clare leaned back in [her]139-clare corner , and wondered how [she]139-clare should break the news to [that poor widow]2808-that poor widow . But when [they]2809-they reached [[Earl]285-earl 's Terrace]2810-earl 's terrace , and found out [the house where [she]2808-that poor widow was]2811-the house where she was , [they]2809-they found , too , that there was no need to break the news to [her]2808-that poor widow . [She]2808-that poor widow knew it already , as [Clare]139-clare saw in a moment . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch did not come in , and [the two women]3268-the two women met alone . What [Clare]139-clare said to [her]2808-that poor widow ? It is beyond [us]2813-us to write that down ; and if the words were set down here , despoiled of the tender tones , the eloquent gesture , the heart - warm tenderness of [the young girl]2814-the young girl , who had [herself]2814-the young girl felt grief , what would they be worth ? In the presence of sorrow [some women]2815-some women are inspired , but not with words that will bear reporting . [Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield 's grief was not violent . [She]2808-that poor widow wept , but not bitterly . ' It is [the Lord]1124-the lord 's will , '[2808-that poor widow] [she]2808-that poor widow said , and [she]2808-that poor widow believed [her]2808-that poor widow words . When [she]2808-that poor widow heard of [[her]2808-that poor widow daughter]1329-her daughter 's marriage [she]2808-that poor widow said simply , ' Thank [God]110-god for a '[2808-that poor widow] [His]2817-he mercies ! [I]0-i doubt [He]2817-he 's been ower good to [we]2813-us [i]0-i ' mony ways , an '[2813-us] [we]2813-us mun bear what [He]2817-he 's pleased to lay upo ' [us]2813-us . '[139-clare] [Clare]139-clare would have been more at ease to have seen [her]1329-her daughter weep freely , but [she]139-clare seemed crushed . This last blow had mercifully benumbed [her]139-clare senses . Not [her]139-clare gratitude , though , for when [Clare]139-clare rose to go [she]139-clare rose too , and , taking [the girl]367-the girl 's hands in [hers]139-clare , looked at [her]367-the girl and said , — ' An '[139-clare] [thee]367-the girl came a ' th '[139-clare] way fro ' [Lunnon]286-lunnon to help [an old wife]4593-an old wife to bear [her]4593-an old wife burdens . Eh ! but [thee'rt]367-the girl [a bonnie lass]4594-a bonnie lass , and as good as [thee'rt]367-the girl comely . [Thee'll]367-the girl be the light o '[139-clare] [some honest lad]2819-some honest lad 's e'en some day , and may [thee]367-the girl ha ' as good a man as [mine]139-clare were . '[139-clare] [Clare]139-clare kissed the faded face . [She]139-clare had not so kissed many faces . [She]139-clare put [her]139-clare young , round , soft arms round [the woman]3264-the woman 's neck , and said ' Good - bye . '[139-clare] ' [You]367-the girl 'll see [me]139-clare again , or hear , '[139-clare] [she]139-clare said . ' There 's some words as [Alice]134-alice were fond o '[139-clare] saying time agone , and [I]0-i 'll say 'em to [thee]367-the girl , [[my]0-i lass]4595-my lass , for [I]0-i 'll not see [thee]367-the girl agen , m'appen , and [they]4596-they say [my]0-i meanin '[0-i] clearer nor talk o ' [mine]0-i . " [The Lord]1124-the lord bless [thee]367-the girl and keep [thee]367-the girl , [the Lord]1124-the lord make [His]1124-the lord face to shine upon [thee]367-the girl and be gracious unto [thee]367-the girl , [the Lord]1124-the lord lift up the light of [His]1124-the lord countenance upon [thee]367-the girl , and give [thee]367-the girl peace . " '[141-mrs hatfield] [Mrs Hatfield]141-mrs hatfield opened the gate for [Clare]139-clare to pass out . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch did not seem to see [her]139-clare , yet when [Clare]139-clare was on [his]179-petrovitch arm again [he]179-petrovitch said , — ' [That woman]4600-that woman is marked by Death . [She]4600-that woman will not live three months . [Her]4600-that woman heart is broken . '[179-petrovitch] It was . [His]179-petrovitch words came true . When [the two]2933-the two were once more in [the train]1421-the train [Clare]139-clare 's silent mood had passed . [She]139-clare would gladly have talked , but [the carriage]398-the carriage was full , and [[her]139-clare companion]3320-her companion 's place being on the opposite side of [the carriage]398-the carriage , anything but an occasional word was impossible . [She]139-clare sat gazing out of the window , and [he]179-petrovitch sat in the opposite corner looking at [her]139-clare fixedly . As [they]2933-the two were passing over the bridge to the [London]6-london terminus [he]179-petrovitch leaned forward suddenly , and [she]139-clare , anticipating some words from [his]179-petrovitch movement , withdrew [her]139-clare eyes from [the sun - bathed , rippling river]2826-the sun - bathed , rippling river and fixed them on [his]179-petrovitch . There [she]139-clare met such a look of passion , and love , and longing as [she]139-clare had never seen in [any man]2780-any man 's eyes before ; and as [she]139-clare gazed , startled , spell - bound , [his]179-petrovitch voice whispered these words , in a tone too low for any ears but [hers]139-clare , and yet distinct enough for every word to be plainly heard by [her]139-clare , and to make [her]139-clare heart bound responsively . Only these words , — ' Whatever happens , [I]179-petrovitch shall always love [you]139-clare . '[179-petrovitch] Then [he]179-petrovitch leaned back again . [Clare]139-clare drew a deep breath , and [the train]1421-the train stopped at [the Charing Cross platform]2829-the charing cross platform . No other word was said between [them]2830-them till [he]179-petrovitch had called [a cab]2970-a cab and placed [her]139-clare in it . Then [he]179-petrovitch said , ' Do not write to [me]179-petrovitch : [I]179-petrovitch will write to [you]139-clare . '[179-petrovitch] [He]179-petrovitch pressed [her]139-clare hand , drew back , and [the cab]2832-the cab was driven off . As [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch walked back to [[his]179-petrovitch lodgings]2654-his lodgings the sky grew quickly cloudy . It seemed as though the sunshine had gone away with [Clare Stanley]139-clare . By the time [he]179-petrovitch reached [Osnaburgh Street]102-osnaburgh street the rain was beginning to fall in big heavy splashes on [the dusty pavement]2834-the dusty pavement . [He]179-petrovitch strode up the stairs to [[his]179-petrovitch room]3391-his room , locked the door , and flung [himself]179-petrovitch down in the elbow - chair by the fireless grate . The rising wind blew the rain in gusts against the uncurtained window , and the large drops chased each other down the panes and obscured the view of [the high houses opposite]2836-the high houses opposite . All the sweetness had gone out of the weather . [Petrovitch]179-petrovitch noticed it , and felt glad that it was so . [He]179-petrovitch sat quite still and quite silent , [his]179-petrovitch elbow on the arm of [his]179-petrovitch chair , and [his]179-petrovitch forehead on [his]179-petrovitch hand . Now indeed the dark hour was upon [Saul]287-saul . For six months [his]179-petrovitch dream , [his]179-petrovitch hope , [his]179-petrovitch ambition had been to return to [Russia]26-russia . Now [he]179-petrovitch was going at last , and the thought of it was maddening . [He]179-petrovitch had known that [he]179-petrovitch loved [Clare]139-clare , but [he]179-petrovitch had not known how much [he]179-petrovitch loved [her]139-clare until that moment in [the train]1421-the train , and then [his]179-petrovitch sudden knowledge of the strength of [his]179-petrovitch own passion had broken down all [his]179-petrovitch resolutions . How could [he]179-petrovitch have been such a fool as ever to speak the words which made it impossible for [him]179-petrovitch to see [her]139-clare again ? [He]179-petrovitch had not meant to speak them . [He]179-petrovitch could not understand how [he]179-petrovitch had come to speak [them]2838-them . [Their]2838-them utterance was the first unguarded action [he]179-petrovitch had been guilty of for the last ten years . And [he]179-petrovitch had thought with some reason that [he]179-petrovitch could rely on [his]179-petrovitch own cool - headedness and self - restraint . Now it seemed [he]179-petrovitch was mistaken . [He]179-petrovitch was as much [the slave of impulse]2839-the slave of impulse as another — as much as [the man who had assumed [his]179-petrovitch name]2840-the man who had assumed his name . It was incomprehensible to [him]179-petrovitch . [He]179-petrovitch quite failed to understand the full force of this new over - mastering emotion . [Clare]139-clare ! [Clare]139-clare ! [The world]2867-the world seemed to mean nothing but [Clare]139-clare . [He]179-petrovitch thought of [her]139-clare apart from all the other facts and circumstances of life , of [herself]139-clare , [her]139-clare face , [her]139-clare eyes , [her]139-clare hair , [her]139-clare voice , [her]139-clare way of holding [her]139-clare head , the movement of [her]139-clare hands when [she]139-clare spoke , and it was a rapture to think of [her]139-clare like this , and to let the thought of [her]139-clare rush over and sweep away all other thoughts , even of [his]179-petrovitch own life 's aim . Then slowly came back to [him]179-petrovitch the remembrance of all the realities of [his]179-petrovitch life , and [he]179-petrovitch cursed what seemed to [him]179-petrovitch [his]179-petrovitch degradation . What sort of patriotism was it that the touch of [a girl]3064-a girl 's hand could wither ? What principles were [they]2843-they that the look in [a girl]3064-a girl 's eyes could destroy ? It was an utterly new experience for [him]179-petrovitch , and [he]179-petrovitch felt as though [his]179-petrovitch patriotism and [his]179-petrovitch faith were dead within [him]179-petrovitch . In that hour [he]179-petrovitch was [man]473-man first , patriot after . But the hour of weakness was , after all , a brief one . [His]179-petrovitch patriotism was not dead . It had been [[his]179-petrovitch master]2846-his master - passion too long for such an easy death to be possible , and as the dusk fell and deepened into night it rose up and met that other passion in [the field]383-the field and vanquished it . It was late when [he]179-petrovitch rose and lighted [his]179-petrovitch lamp . It shone upon a face white with the struggle [he]179-petrovitch had gone through , but set and determined . [He]179-petrovitch turned to [his]179-petrovitch table and wrote , — ' [I]179-petrovitch love [you]2848-you ! [I]179-petrovitch told [you]2848-you so to - day . [I]179-petrovitch did not mean to tell [you]2848-you , and [I]179-petrovitch can not account for or excuse the impulse that made [me]179-petrovitch do so . '[179-petrovitch] But , having done so , [I]0-i can not ask [you]2848-you to meet [me]0-i again as [comrades]4590-comrades meet . It would be embarrassing for [you]2848-you , and for [me]0-i impossible . [I]0-i know [you]2848-you do not love [me]0-i . Perhaps [you]2848-you will even despise [me]0-i when [you]2848-you learn what has been the temptation [I]0-i have undergone . To give up [Russia]26-russia — the Cause — the Revolution — everything — and to stay at peace in [England]15-england , and give [my]0-i whole soul to the effort to win [your]2848-you love . [I]0-i am glad to think [I]0-i am not so unworthy of [you]2848-you as [I]0-i should have been had [I]0-i yielded to this — the strongest temptation of [my]0-i life . [I]0-i shall leave [London]6-london to - morrow morning ; [I]0-i can not stay so near [you]2848-you without seeing [you]2848-you . ' [You]2848-you will think [me]0-i ungenerous in leaving [you]2848-you without any advice on the subject [you]2848-you desire to be advised on . [You]2848-you shall hear from [me]0-i before long . Perhaps when [I]0-i am further from [you]2848-you [I]0-i shall be better able to write [you]2848-you the sort of letter [you]2848-you will care to have from [me]0-i . For [those who love Liberty]4601-those who love liberty , life is made up of renunciations , but no renunciation could be so difficult , so bitter , as is to [me]0-i the renouncing of this least faint ghost of a chance of winning [you]2848-you . [Michael]121-litvinoff . '[0-i] [He]0-i went out and posted the letter , and when [he]0-i came in again did not indulge in any more reflections . [He]0-i busied [himself]0-i with packing up [his]0-i belongings , paying [his]0-i rent , and making all [his]0-i arrangements for leaving [London]6-london the next morning . But when the next morning came , with a fresh radiance of blue skies and sunlight , all [his]0-i plans were overturned , all [his]0-i thought unsettled , by this telegram , ' [Clare Stanley]139-clare , [Marlborough Villa]69-marlborough villa , [N.W.]103-n.w. , to [Michael Petrovitch]179-petrovitch , 37 , [Osnaburgh Street]102-osnaburgh street , N.W.—You are not going without good - bye . Please be in [the Guildhall]4602-the guildhall at twelve . '[2850-most men in his position] [Most men in [his]0-i position]2850-most men in his position would have been [there]2994-there at eleven at the latest . But the clock was on the first stroke of twelve as [he]0-i walked through the crowd of fat pigeons , who , as usual , were busily eating more than was good for [them]2852-them in [the Guildhall yard]2853-the guildhall yard . [He]0-i passed through the arched entrance and stood in the doorway . [No one]494-no one would have guessed by [his]0-i face that [he]0-i was keeping an appointment made by [the woman [he]0-i loved]4425-the woman he loved . [He]0-i looked white and haggard , wretched and weary . [His]0-i glance travelled round [the large hall]2856-the large hall . In front of the statue of [the Earl of Chatham]285-earl stood the graceful black figure [he]0-i looked for . [He]0-i walked across to [her]4425-the woman he loved . As [his]0-i footsteps sounded on the stone floor [she]4425-the woman he loved turned [her]4425-the woman he loved head , but did not move to meet [him]0-i . When [he]0-i was quite close to [her]4425-the woman he loved [she]4425-the woman he loved held out [her]4425-the woman he loved hand in silence . [He]0-i took it , pressed it , and let it fall at once . [He]0-i spoke almost sternly . ' Why did [you]0-i bring [me]0-i [here]2895-here ? [I]0-i told [you]4425-the woman he loved it was impossible for [us]4604-us to meet on the old terms . '[0-i] ' [I]4425-the woman he loved asked [you]0-i to meet [me]4425-the woman he loved here , '[4425-the woman he loved] [she]4425-the woman he loved said , ' because [I]4425-the woman he loved had to come into [the City]3372-the city on money affairs ; and for the other , [I]4425-the woman he loved have not asked [you]0-i to do the impossible . '[4425-the woman he loved] [She]4425-the woman he loved , too , was very pale , and spoke with what seemed like an effort at lightness . ' It is unworthy of [you]4425-the woman he loved , '[0-i] [he]0-i went on , hardly noticing [her]4425-the woman he loved answer , ' to make [my]0-i renunciation so much harder for [me]0-i . '[0-i] ' There are enough inevitable renunciations in life for [us]4606-us without [our]4606-us making [others]658-others by misunderstandings , '[4425-the woman he loved] [she]4425-the woman he loved said , [her]4425-the woman he loved eyelids downcast . [He]0-i looked at [her]4425-the woman he loved silently , as [a man]2882-a man might in a dream which [he]0-i feared to break by a word . At last [he]0-i spoke , in a very low voice , with [his]0-i eyes still on [her]4425-the woman he loved face . ' This is glory to know , '[0-i] [he]0-i said , ' but do [you]4425-the woman he loved think it makes the sacrifice more easy ? Before it was only a chance [I]0-i gave up — now it is [your]4425-the woman he loved very self [I]0-i must renounce . '[0-i] ' Why ? '[4425-the woman he loved] [Her]4425-the woman he loved voice trembled a little now . ' Because [I]4425-the woman he loved must return to [Russia]26-russia . [[My]4425-the woman he loved place]4608-my place is there , and where [I]4425-the woman he loved go — '[4425-the woman he loved] ' [I]4425-the woman he loved , too , will go , '[4425-the woman he loved] [she]4425-the woman he loved interrupted . [He]0-i caught [her]4425-the woman he loved wrist . ' But if [you]4425-the woman he loved go with [me]0-i [you]4425-the woman he loved go to almost certain death . '[0-i] Does that matter ? ' [she]4425-the woman he loved said , and looked full in [his]0-i eyes . [His]0-i fingers had closed on [hers]4425-the woman he loved , and so [they]2858-they went out together into the bright English sunshine . Not more serenely , not more gladly , than [they]2858-they would hereafter go , hand in hand , into the black darkness and oblivion that waits to swallow [those who dare to set [themselves]2859-those who dare to set themselves against the bitter tyranny of russia against the bitter tyranny of [Russia]26-russia]2859-those who dare to set themselves against the bitter tyranny of russia . To each of [them]2858-they that day had given the most perfect gift of life , and [both]2937-both were content to offer up that gift — life itself even — for the sake of the Liberty [they]2858-they loved — [the Liberty who , though [she]2862-she may not crown [their]2858-they lives]2861-the liberty who , though she may not crown their lives — will consecrate [their]2858-they graves .
